article_title: Muhlenberg rescinds honorary degree awarded to Bill Cosby
article_text:
ALLENTOWN, Pa. (AP) — Muhlenberg College has become the latest school to rescind an honorary degree awarded to Bill Cosby following renewed accusations of sexual assault against the comedian.

Faculty, staff and students at the private liberal arts college in eastern Pennsylvania were told in an email Tuesday that the board of trustees had voted Friday to revoke the degree conferred on Cosby in 1995.

Board chairman Richard Crist says "substantial and credible information" that was unavailable at the time indicates that Cosby's conduct "substantially and materially offends the college's principles and ideals."

Cosby has never been charged with a crime and has continued to deny allegations from several women that he drugged and sexually assaulted them years ago.

A number of other schools also have rescinded honorary degrees given to Cosby.
